topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the Horizon Patch

body.section:
If you are unable to create a PCI-Passthrough or SR-IOV interface using the Horizon UI, but can create those interfces using CLI, you need to apply the Horizon Patch.
Note: If you applied the Horizon Patch, WR-HZN-1011 during installation, and can create PCI-Passthrough or SR-IOV interfaces in Horizon, disregard these steps.
Due to an API error, you cannot create a PCI-Passthrough or SR-IOV interface using the Horizon UI. To correct this issue, deploy the following patch. You should have downloaded the following patch files during the prerequisites:
WR-HZN-1011

Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Click Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Horizon001 Patch002 and download the patch.

section.title: Install the patch
section.p: The patch is in a compressed file called HCG2.0_Horizon001_Patch002.tar.gz. The README with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.

Execute the following commands:
Copy the WR-HZN-1011 directory to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches directory on the lifecycle manager.
Execute following command to apply patch hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n WR-HZN-1011 -t <tier>
Where: <tier> is the tier on which the various controllers are running. For example: hlm patch -c sac36 -n WR-HZN-1011 -t BASE-CCP-T2The tier information can be found in the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/desired_state/<cloudname>/001/base/stage/ansible/hosts file.
